channel.title: Pages on Joy of Coding
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on Joy of Coding

item.title: About
item.description: We are organising for fun, not for profit. The people behind Joy of Coding are an informal group, backed by a legal entity (the Devnology Foundation). We are organising this for fun, not for profit. Felienne Hermans I am assistant professor and speaker. I strive to make programming better and easier for non-programmers. I love functional programming and board games. @felienne Arne Timmerman Software engineer and community facilitator.

item.title: Code of Conduct
item.description: Celebrating the art, craft, science and joy of software development ―  Code of Conduct All attendees, speakers, hosts, sponsors and volunteers (all these further referred to as participants) at our events are subject to the following code of conduct. We will enforce this code throughout all our events and are expecting cooperation from all participants to help ensuring a safe environment for everybody. No harrassment We are dedicated to providing harassment-free events for everyone, regardless of gender, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion (or lack thereof).

item.title: Joining instructions
item.description: Speaker instructions Practical information for Joy of Coding 2017 speakers. Please see the attendee joining instructions for more information. Arrival in Rotterdam The six main conference speakers are staying five minutes’ walk from the venue. Hotel address: Rotterdam Marriott Hotel, Weena 686, 3012CN Rotterdam Speakers’ dinner The six main conference speakers can meet each other and the organisers before the pre-party for dinner at a Thai restaurant, 17:30-19:00.

item.title: Joining instructions
item.description: Joining instructions Practical information for all conference attendees and speakers. Before the conference Follow the speakers on Twitter, via our Joy of Coding 2017 list. Sign-up for the pre-party, on Thursday evening in Rotterdam. Read the conference Code of Conduct. What to take Take a laptop for the AIsland coding challenge. Getting there Address: Rotterdamse Schouwburg, Schouwburgplein 25, 3012 CL Rotterdam By plane/train: get the train to Rotterdam Central Station and walk 8 minutes to the venue.

item.title: Schedule 2017
item.description: Hi there, have a look at our 2017 schedule! Have a look at al the inspiring speakers that will come to Rotterdam on 30 June. Most slots are links to more detailed information. 08:30 - 09:20 08:30 - 09:20 Walk in @ Main hall 08:30 - 09:20 Registration @ Foyer 09:20 - 09:30 09:20 - 09:30 Opening and introduction to the AIsland Game Contest @ Main hall 09:30 - 10:10 Keynote09:30 - 10:10 Living the good life Ted Neward@ Main hall 10:10 - 10:50 10:10 - 10:50 Break @ Foyer Game10:10 - 10:50 AIsland Game Contest @ Foyer 10:50 - 11:30 Talk10:50 - 11:30 Shaving the golden yak Jessica Kerr@ Main hall Game10:50 - 11:30 AIsland Game Contest @ Foyer 11:30 - 12:10 Community11:30 - 12:10 Lightning talks @ Main hall Networking11:30 - 12:10 Speed meeting @ Foyer 12:10 - 13:10 12:10 - 13:10 Lunch @ Foyer Game12:10 - 13:10 AIsland Game Contest @ Foyer 13:10 - 13:50 Keynote13:10 - 13:50 Stories every developer should know Neal Ford@ Main hall 13:50 - 14:30 Talk13:50 - 14:30 Mob programming Llewellyn Falco@ Main hall Game13:50 - 14:30 AIsland Game Contest @ Foyer 14:30 - 15:10 14:30 - 15:10 Break @ Foyer Game14:30 - 15:10 AIsland Game Contest @ Foyer 15:10 - 15:50 Talk15:10 - 15:50 How to hire and work with people who aren’t like you Koshin Mariano@ Main hall Game15:10 - 15:50 AIsland Game Contest @ Foyer 15:50 - 16:30 Keynote15:50 - 16:30 The joy of stochastic gradient descent Carin Meier@ Main hall 16:30 - 16:50 16:30 - 16:50 RoboCup Junior demo @ Main hall 16:50 - 20:00 16:50 - 20:00 Drinks/dinner @ Foyer Game17:30 AIsland finals @ Foyer Tickets 2017

item.title: Venue
item.description: Celebrating the art, craft, science and joy of software development ―  Our 2017 venue: De Rotterdamse Schouwburg Joy of Coding 2017 will take place at the Rotterdamse Schouwburg, a theatre in the centre of Rotterdam. While this venue usually hosts dance, theatre and music theatre productions, it offers ideal conference facilities. The location is on the central Rotterdam square of the same name, Schouwbergplein. Getting there Address: Rotterdamse Schouwburg, Schouwburgplein 25, 3012 CL Rotterdam
